Authors:
Susumu Takamatsu, Sung-Eun Cho, Jamjan Meeboon, Hyeon-Dong
Shin
Title:
Revisiting Erysiphe magnoliae with morphological and
molecular data
Keywords:
Anamorph, Magnolia, Microsphaera, Powdery mildew,
Taxonomy
Abstract:
Erysiphe magnoliae known on Magnolia obovata is a powdery
mildew endemic to Japan. The morphological characteristics of the
species have been insufficiently known since its first description in
1951. Fresh samples of this species were collected on M. obovata for the
first time in Korea. Based on the Korean samples, both anamorph and
teleomorph of this species were described and illustrated in detail. The
inflated base of foot-cells in conidiophores is a unique character not
found in the two related species, E. magnifica and E. bulbosa, known on
Magnolia spp. The sequence of internal transcribed spacer (ITS) and 28S
of ribosomal DNA obtained from Korean and Japanese samples confirmed its
placement in the section Microsphaera of the genus Erysiphe in
phylogenetic position. Comparison and synoptic key of the three species
of Erysiphe known on Magnolia spp. were provided.
